title: Mum who 'raised £17,000 for dying daughter's bucket list' is charged with her murder

A mum who allegedly took donation's for her 'dying' daughter's bucket list has been charged with her murder.

Kelly Renee Turner, 41, allegedly claimed that her daughter Olivia, seven, had been diagnosed with a brain tumour at just 13 months old.

She also said Olivia, who died in 2017, was suffering from excess fluid on the brain, autism, epilepsy and coeliac disease.

Turner, from Denver, Colorado, is also accused of persuading doctors to sign a 'do not resuscitate' order for the child.

The mum is now accused of suffering from Munchausen syndrome by proxy, where parents or carers lie about a loved one being seriously ill for attention.

(Image: Denver Police)

(Image: Denver Police)

The alleged killer reportedly told medics that Olivia’s quality of life was so poor it would be kinder to let her die and stop all nutrition and medication.

Horrified medics have since spoken out saying Olivia was not a terminal patient.

During her hospital stints, Turner gave regular updates on her health online and even encouraged local media to film the youngster ticking things off her bucket list.

Her bucket list activities included being a firefighter and putting out a blaze, as well as riding in a police car and becoming a superhero called ‘Bat Girl.’

Turner, who denies killing her daughter, allegedly collected at least $22,000 (around £17,000) in donations from well-wishers.

The GoFundMe page set up to help with Olivia's bucket list said: "We are hoping for support both financially, spiritually, and emotionally.

(Image: 9News)

(Image: 9News)

"Not only will this be a taxing time for Kelly (mom), and Olivia but for Olivia’s sisters and the friends and family who are willing to step in and help during this time."

Turner also allegedly defrauded a funeral home and cemetery who offered to bury Olivia.

After Olivia's death, police began to investigate Turner's claims when the mum began saying her eldest daughter was also battling cancer.

Olivia's body was exhumed but an official cause of death is yet to be established.

Turner faces 13 charges including murder, child abuse, fraud, attempting to influence a public servant and forgery.

She is being held without bond and is due in court at a later date.
description: Kelly Renee Turner, 41, from Canada, allegedly claimed that her daughter Olivia, six, was suffering from a terminal brain tumour
